main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted near the Osan Air Base in Korea on November 14, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as having a reddish-yellow to whitish-yellow color, oval shape, and disc-like appearance that would disappear and reappear in the clouds.
The object moved erratically and quickly, with observers estimating its speed at 500-600 knots (roughly 575-690 mph) at an altitude of 25,000 feet.
The object was observed for 15-30 seconds by two different observers, a GCA operator and another man, before disappearing into the clouds.
The weather conditions at the time included low clouds, high winds at altitude, and clear visibility of 7 miles.
The observers were certain the object was not a conventional aircraft and were shaken by the experience, with the report author inclined to take their account at face value.
sighted object: oval-shaped, disc-like object that changed color from reddish-yellow to whitish-yellow
